intro: Pentachaeta paleacea, commonly known as the paleflower pentachaeta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Pentachaeta paleacea is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
